message.content:
cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SC, cs.LO, cs.CG

Reasoning: The paper deals with the complexity of polynomial identity testing (PIT) for arithmetic circuits, which is a central problem in computational complexity theory. The paper also introduces new concepts and measures related to circuit complexity. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The paper also involves the study of hitting-sets, which are related to data structures and algorithms, and hence cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also involves the study of lower bounds and the complexity of solving PIT, which are related to computational geometry and topology, and hence cs.SC (Computational Geometry) and cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper involves the study of specific models of arithmetic circuits, which are related to computer graphics and visualization, and hence cs.CG (Computer Graphics) is also a likely sub-category.
